item.title: My Emacs Init File
item.description: Steps install ido-vertical install company install solarized-dark install ess install yasnippet install poly-R install smex install expand-region install aggressive-indent install org-bullet install session install undo-tree install auto-complete install anzu add molokai-theme-kit.el in to .emacs.d Can be found in simplenote file.
item.content:
Steps

  1. install ido-vertical
  2. install company
  3. install solarized-dark
  4. install ess
  5. install yasnippet
  6. install poly-R
  7. install smex
  8. install expand-region
  9. install aggressive-indent
  10. install org-bullet
  11. install session
  12. install undo-tree
  13. install auto-complete
  14. install anzu
  15. add molokai-theme-kit.el in to .emacs.d

Can be found in simplenote file.

item.title: Back to Github
item.description: Finally Something about github: if you want to delete commit from github, here are the steps you want to use (Reference website): git reset –hard <commit-id> git push origin -f
item.content:
Finally

Something about github:

if you want to delete commit from github, here are the steps you want to use (Reference website):

  1. git reset –hard <commit-id>
  2. git push origin -f

item.title: Another Birthday Again
item.description: This is another birthday. I didn’t do anything special. Tried a lot of new Emacs features and really love it!
item.content:
This is another birthday.

I didn’t do anything special.

Tried a lot of new Emacs features and really love it!

item.title: Mac Jekyll Note
item.description: Jekyll Note 1. A little problem Learning from youtube In terminal (using Python 2.7 instead of Python 3.4) install vertualenv {% highlight R %} pip install virtualenv {% endhighlight R %} using Python 2.7 as temporary virtualenv -p /usr/bin/python2.7 –distribute temp-python active Python 2.7 source temp-python/bin/activate stop using python2.7 deactivate 2. Start Jekyll Then begin jekyll in your workspace jekyll new blogname
item.content:
Jekyll Note

1. A little problem

Learning from youtube

In terminal (using Python 2.7 instead of Python 3.4)

install vertualenv

{% highlight R %}

pip install virtualenv {% endhighlight R %}

using Python 2.7 as temporary

virtualenv -p /usr/bin/python2.7 –distribute temp-python

active Python 2.7

source temp-python/bin/activate

stop using python2.7

deactivate

2. Start Jekyll

Then begin jekyll in your workspace

jekyll new blogname

jekyll serve
